column4: How can I check what compileoptions a repoinstalled packaged had ?
I have the source .. but how does that help me determine what compileoptions the package I currently have installed had ?
you have a directory with files in it after running « apt-get source PACKAGE » right?
inside you have a directory called "debian".  Inside that you have a file called "rules".  If you read the contents of that file, you will know how it is compiled
so, basicly, I can add any compile option to that rules file, do a ./configure, make && make install, and I'll have an equal install, only with the extra setting enabled ?
nope, you want to build the package the debian way
but if you read the earlier link about grabbing the source, it tells you the command to run to rebuild the package
erm, you also want to make sure you increment the version and append something like ~milligan to the end of the version string.  That way apt doesn't keep bugging you about upgrading the package
thanks mate. Lots of nice info :)
I suppose I'm better of making some sort of workaround for my problem, since upgrading packages is going to be hell if I change them.
or point a gun at a dev member to fix the package so it can support all options.
well once you do it one time, it shouldn't be too bad.  The package isn't going to get updated every week
